p: The key informants discussed the impact of the pandemic on their institutional sustainability agendas. A digital shift has taken place during the course of the pandemic. The academic community is sharing research findings, coordinating projects, conducting interviews and learning online. This has resulted in a massive reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from air travel and commuting by car, but this gain for the climate has come at a devastating cost for human health and well‐being. It is therefore incumbent upon us to maintain these new low carbon ways of working and not waste this lesson that came at such an enormous cost [16].
